channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road Signs Unreadable, 28th February
item.description:
Three street signs are dirty to the point where you can't read the sign. Two are triangle signs for humps. Both on Hurst Road, in between Crofton Avenue and Shirley Avenue, all signs are in the Hurst Community Centre side of the road, where the trees are low.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 375, Hurst Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Circa 1 sq.m pink vinyl advertisement banner affixed to Council footway railings on the elevated public footway fronting 41, High Street, Beckenham (near Gail's cafe) about 20m S of the jct with Bromley Rd., 28th February
item.description:
Circa 1 sq.m pink vinyl advertisement banner affixed to Council footway railings on the elevated public footway fronting 41, High Street, Beckenham (near Gail's cafe) about 20m S of the jct with Bromley Rd. Conservation Area. The ad is for a women's business event at the Bridge Bar, Beckenham. Seen Friday 27th and Saturday 28/2/26. The Bridge Bar has a track record of flyposting in Beckenham over 20 years. Flyposting is a criminal offence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised / unlawful road closure, 28th February
item.description:
This road closure sign has been displayed for over a week with work scheduled to start on Monday. The works have no displayed permit number. The worksdetaiks are not shown on Bromley’s interactive map. The phone number displayed on the board does not work. I and neighbours have tried calling but there is no connection. I have tried calling Bromley council to enquire about the works and been sent round in circles by an automated system. When I did get a person I was told I needed a different department and put through to the switchboard, where the operator simply put my call back into the automated circular system. The board says our road will be closed. Residents have been provided with no information whatsoever. I have a gas engineer coming during the week who will need access. My neighbour needs to take her two small children to nursery. Other neighbours also require access. These roadworks cannot take place until conditions are fulfilled in terms of providing information on access and proper permits are obtained and displayed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Streamside Close, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several large potholes at the start of Sprules Road, 28th February
item.description:
Several large potholes have opened up and the road surface is pitted and crumbling. The road was resurfaced fairly recently but new potholes have opened up where there were potholes before. The massive heavy electric buses don’t help, but I think a substantial fix to the foundations of the road itself is needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sprules Road, New Cross Gate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street sign (load limit) at the junction of Finchley Road and 64 Burrard Road NW6 Road NW6 1DD, 28th February
item.description:
There is a road sign indicating load limit. It has a small light at the top which is on during daytime. The sign is dirty and both sign and light are partially obscured by the foliage of a tree. I have noticed this for the past couple of weeks, early afternoon on Saturdays NB: I had to report this as a problem with railings otherwise I wasn't able to progress to the next screen. But it is nothing to do with railings, only a street sign (for drivers)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Burrard Road, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
